website_summaries.verdict: Good price point for those looking for a battery charger and maintainer for small battery sizes.
pros: Small charger that works well for smaller, common household batteries
Good performance automatically without needing constant checking
Alligator clips and ring terminals to fit different types of battery terminals
cons: May not last as long as some larger and more expensive models

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy it overcharged my battery and ruined it and all the wires. I am not happy it is supposed to stop charging when it reaches full charge. This charger cost me a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: B Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Chinese Garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: Chinese Garbage! Dead out of the box. Can't even take shipping, how is it supposed to take normal wear and tear. Not worth the waste of time! I am returning and looking for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: I’m not confident in this product. I purchased a ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m not confident in this product. I purchased a new LA deep cycle battery for my RV. Before using the battery this charger topped it up to 12.7 before shutting off (that’s good). After my first usage, same thing (still good). After my second battery usage and third recharge it continues to charge past 13v and I’m concerned it may have overcharged/damaged my battery.
customer_reviews.author: briandrew1

customer_reviews.title: so good. Only been using a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Only been using a few weeks. Keeps my boat battery charged. ****update***** 9 months later, it died. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Eli Watts

customer_reviews.title: I purchased two of these - sending back - on ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these - sending back - on the same battery I get two different readings from the indicator light. The graphic on the front is not how it works (or does not work in my case). I compared this with the B&D and FOVAL and this does not seem to charge fast nor does it top off the batteries (stops before 12V).
customer_reviews.author: JoelB

customer_reviews.title: A real Let Down
customer_reviews.text: Had these connected to my Jet Skis hoping they would maintain the Battery while it was sitting there till I had some free time well had some free time and Got to spend it Charging the Battery that this Automatic Battery Charger was supposed to Maintain? Now Out of Warranty so $15.00 Dollars Lost, more Importantly, my whole day of Jets Sking was lost. Stick with the Premium Brands on these.
customer_reviews.author: Jay F Kullmann

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Had an almost dead Battery on my Screaming Eagle Electra Glide Classic, wouldn't even click. My granddaughter had turned on the accessories switch for the amps. This was sitting in the box, hadnt had time to really mess with it yet. I installed it, total time from getting wrenches to putting them away from install, less than 5 minutes. I plugged the charger in and walked away. Next morning I checked the voltage on battery. After about 9-10 hours of charging over night, battery was good. Bike fired right up. The indicator on unit showed it had gone from a full charge to a maintenance charge indicator. I highly recommend. Will be buying a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: Teenage 50's

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Plug it to my Harley didn't get a beep out of it. Battery was low so I jump it with car fully charged. Plug it to motopower and next day didn't keep the charge . So far not what I expected. Might be the battery that's bad so I'm going to replace battery . And plug it up if it works I will retract review and review it again . But for now very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Eloy P.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t look at any other brand. These are the real deal at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Owning sports cars and motorcycles, I’m constantly looking for and using battery tenders weekly. Using the other brand it’s simply a float charger and doesn’t disulfide like the Motopower. I will be replacing my chargers with Motopowers for my whole collection. UPDATE: 4 months later it’s working so well, I’ve bought a second one. It brought back to life a $95 battery that was dead overnight!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: I was very suprised how well it works haven been made in china!
customer_reviews.text: This little Motopower battery maintainer/charger suprised me because I too have read all the negative reviews left by others about how bad these work haven been made in china and sold on amazon, but mine so far is working really well doing the job it was designed and made for. The little indicator light is so far a good reference for when it is charging and it goes green when the battery is charged up and ready to go. Only time will tell how well these china made chargers/ maintainers really are in spite of all the idiots negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: joseph Krins

customer_reviews.title: All day long.
customer_reviews.text: Affordable, practical, all you need to keep your batteries from going bad in the winter. These tenders are sweet. Decent length of chord to reach from the wall and the length of the chords on the clamp ends are long as well. Won’t leave you short. Don’t fall for the expensive stuff. These are cheap and durable and they do the job. I boroughs one for my riding mower and liked it so much that I bought two more for my ATVs. Now I have three and my batteries are safe from the cold of the winter out in my unheated garage. Great alternative to the more expensive tender/charger. Buy one...or three.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Parker

customer_reviews.title: Two out of two, DOA
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these. Both had the same problem. I plugged them into AC power, the power light came on - Good sign right? I connected the clamps to the battery, only the power light was on - Oh, Oh. I pulled out and tested the Volt meter to make sure that I had a working Volt meter. I connected the Volt meter to the output end of the unit, no output voltage - see the video.
customer_reviews.author: Digitrash

customer_reviews.title: Only works for a short period of time
customer_reviews.text: This charger worked really well for 7 months now it doesn’t even work. The green light is on to show that there is power but it won’t charge the battery anymore. The charging indicator light won’t come on using the clamps or using the rings.
customer_reviews.author: Lady J

customer_reviews.title: Charger does not maintain your battery. Leave it on long enough, you will have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.text: This charger does not maintain your battery. Leave it on long enough, you will have to buy a new battery. I remove another chinese charger because it would only charge and not maintain the battery. This one claims to do it. Connected battery, led was red, eventually went green, good, seems to be working. What caught my attention was that the charger was still hot 3 days later. So I decided to check the output, low and behold, the float voltage is 14.2 volts. I dont know of a single battery that has a float voltage of 14.2 volts. I would like to have a refund of my money please.
customer_reviews.author: Rednose

customer_reviews.title: Very Cheap and Basic
customer_reviews.text: This is the very minimum charger. It has no status lights other than for it having power. Unless you have other instrumentation you do not know if it is working or not, or where it is on a charge cycle. Clips and all else would seem to be minimum quality. I recommend getting something more upscale at higher cost. For this you just plug it in and hope it is doing what you want and at the correct level. The price is cheap but, I think, without needed features and value.
customer_reviews.author: R. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: It's only 800ma
customer_reviews.text: It's been working great for 2 months now. I use it to top off an auxiliary battery in my truck. I plug it in every night after I get home. The only complaint I have is that it charges really slow. That's to be expected though as it's only 800ma. Took more than 15 hours to reach 100% full but since then it's been working as advertised. Update: Didn't work too long. Bought it Jan 7th and it was dead by July 2st. When it works its great. I won't buy another though.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this just 2-3 months ago and it's already stopped working. Nobody mistreated it, nobody dropped it, heck I was only using it for the third time. And now it won't power up at all. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: 1m2

customer_reviews.title: Love this charger.
customer_reviews.text: Love this charger. Keeps the boat battery charged up so it's ready to go when I am. Before the charger the battery was 12.8 volts. Now the charger keeps it 13.2 volts. It charges then maintains the charge without overcharging and harming your battery. Will leave this on over the winter so it will keep the battery fresh and ready in the spring. This will also bring longer life to your battery. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce J.

customer_reviews.title: $$ Value
customer_reviews.text: I have several boy toys and ranch tools that I use irregularly. I have at least six maintainers running all the time. For the money, you save $$ and get the same results as higher priced versions. I haven't had them long enough to tell you the life expectancy, but I have had battery maintainers that have not lasted but a few months. So far, they have performed as good as any. If they do not die on me in a short period of time, I will buy these again. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Bexarman

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my Hummer ready to go!
customer_reviews.text: Since the lock down started my driving has been limited to once every 10 days. My Hummer was not that patient and the battery would die between trips. Now she is always ready to go thanks to this little trickle charger. I was a little skeptical due to the low price but this thing works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Florida_Lawdog

customer_reviews.title: Looked promising but failed to charge a small 6v battery
customer_reviews.text: Seems simple enough to use but failed the first time tried. A small 6v 3ah battery was at 5.2v - charger lit up green Full and did nothing. Tried connect & disconnect, pull AC - wait - plug in again, etc. Still, nothing. Left it for a little while to see if it would poll the battery & start a charge cycle & nothing. Disconnected & checked the battery - the charger had drawn it down 1v to 4.2v. Maybe a defective unit. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: mdcof3

customer_reviews.title: Motopower - very easy to use and see it charging
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of good trickle chargers. With 20+ cars, trucks, tractors, and an ATV, I keep them all on maintenance chargers. I purchased these two Motopower chargers because of price and to try them out. Very happy thus far. With some of my batteries costing over $250, I hope these chargers last a few years. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Mark Visconti

customer_reviews.title: Solved the Problem
customer_reviews.text: My elderly mom drives once per month. He car battery went dead often. It was difficult for her to connect my battery charger under the hood after every drive. The MOTOPOWER battery maintainer solved that problem. I purchased a longer ring terminal cable and used some wiring clips to route it across the engine compartment and out through the grill. The charging unit mounts on a wall nearby. Mom is able to disconnect/reconnect the quick connector before/after each drive. Her dead batter problem is gone. I gave four stars instead of five because I received no answer when I emailed Motopower customer service with a question.
customer_reviews.author: Don Clark

customer_reviews.title: Defective!! Don’t buy!!
customer_reviews.text: The first week I received it I was a able to charge one battery for my scooter, then I tried charging another battery & it stopped working completely. Mode button no longer worked, led indicators no longer indicating. Called amazon & luckily since it hasn’t been 30 days I’ll be able to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Bargain. One of the few units that really does intelligent multi-level charging
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal . However There are an awful lot of fake battery chargers out there that claim that they do intelligent adaptive multi-level charging and regeneration. All you need to do to check and make sure is to put a voltmeter on the device and you will see that once the battery is fully charged the fake units keep right on charging at the same voltage rather than turning off and letting the battery drop in voltage and then turning back to recharge the battery again.
customer_reviews.author: Theophilus DRA

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT charge a fully dead battery - despite heading "Rescue and Recover Batteries"
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money for me. The heading says "Rescue and Recover Batteries" so after having my battery die previously I bought this charger hoping it would save me a call to AAA next time. It turns out my battery did die but upon reading the instructions I found out the battery needs to have a little charge left or this charger won't work at all. Sure enough it is completely useless for recharging my battery or restarting my car.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy F

customer_reviews.title: Blew up my battery!
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work OK until I went in the shop today and wondered about all the chunks of plastic on the floor. Then I noticed the stain on the floor and that the entire top of the battery was missing. The MOTOPOWER charger/maintainer had blown up the battery! So as a maintainer, it FAILS!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Duclos

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful using this tender!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a battery charger/tender for new deep cycle trailer winch battery. This unit popped up in my suggestions so I ordered it. Following day after installing, my wife calls and says there's a terrible smell coming from the trailer. Get home and the charger had boiled the battery over. Luckily the bulk of the mess was contained in the battery box. Nevertheless this charger is complete garbage and managed to cook off a brand new deep cycle marine battery in little over 24 hours. The charger itself was extremely hot and I believe posed a genuine fire risk.
customer_reviews.author: NortonsCustoms

customer_reviews.title: Nice battery maintainer
customer_reviews.text: I've used this daily for a couple of my batteries and it seems to work fine. It goes through a charging process and then maintains after full charge is reached. It also detects defective batteries. I was hoping it would be able to restore a battery but the couple it's identified must be too far gone. It seems like it should last indefinitely. I don't know how weatherproof it is so I gave three stars in that area.
customer_reviews.author: DeanT

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed after 8 months of intermittent use
customer_reviews.text: The amazon listing for this product claims a two year warranty for this batter maintainer. I purchased my unit in late August 2019 and is no longer functional. In truth, I never tested the output of this maintainer until I discovered a dead battery that had been connected to it. The maintainer is currently putting out 1.5 - 2 volts and I don't know if it ever worked. I strongly recommend that you confirm voltage output before connecting it to any of your equipment. I have contacted the manufacturer and will revise my review if I am successful in receiving a replacement unit that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Vince DellaSperanza

customer_reviews.title: Great little charger. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS CHARGER!!! I bought my first one and blew it up! (My fault) as the smoke cleared, and I was able to see my phone, I purchased another one. I installed it in my fishing boat. It is small, easy to use, and charges my battery just fine. I purchased a "thru hull" 110 plug and use this charger as my shore power. It comes with alligator clip connectors, as well as battery terminal connectors. I hard wired my charger. JOB DONE.
customer_reviews.author: John d

customer_reviews.title: Did not charge, cord very short
customer_reviews.text: This charger did not work. From the specs, I ordered it really wanting it to work it's 1.5AMP, comes with SAE quick connects, etc. But unfortunately, when attaching to my battery (I tried two different cars), both lights would turn on solid green indicating that the batteries were fully charged. I tried my other two battery tenders (another brand) and those started charging right away. Also, the Motopower cord is about 8 ft long. My Battery Tender chargers are about 12ft long without the hassle of the charger being in-line with the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Good Bird

customer_reviews.title: It has never been able to charge a single battery I've tried it on in 3 years. POS
customer_reviews.text: Lights go on, almost always says battery is charged and doesn't do anything. If it doesn't say battery is charged, the power light is on and the charging light is off, but blinks red once. I hook up my 20 year old harbor freight trickle charger, and my battery gets charged. I bought this because it's supposed to be automatic, my old charger is manual. This charger just doesn't work. My voltmeter says my battery has 10.4v, this charger says it's fully charged. I'm done with this thing. I overpaid for 2 battery clips.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Keep the battery fully charged..
customer_reviews.text: This trickler works perfect. I'm not a winter motorcycle rider so my Busa is store till spring. Keep battery up to par and fully charged. Got tired of replacing batteries. Even though I would disconnect the cables when not using the bike it would still die out. Well not anymore. Very good for the money..
customer_reviews.author: R A

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive charger if you’re willing to have slower charge
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice and came with many accessories. While they do feel really cheap they definitely work and will hold up if you don’t abuse them. The charger itself doesn’t feel as cheap as any other small trickle charger. Definitely better than the quality of the accessories. Works well and will charge your battery and maintain it as I drained a battery and charged it up overnight. While the charging is slow this is more of an overnight charger don’t get it if you’re impatient. Works well for keeping batteries topped up and charging batteries under 10ah and larger ones will take days if it’s really dead
customer_reviews.author: bonedaddy4538

customer_reviews.title: Charger pack
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because of the positive reviews most gave. After I received it I put it right to use on my Polaris Sportsman 4-wheeler. Unfortunately I didn’t use it as much during the winter so the battery went dead. Anyway, it was easy to use, the attachments (clamps) were small enough to fit down into the battery area and were hefty enough to grab the battery terminals. I set it up waited for 30 minutes or so and bada bing bada boom she started right up. I’m very happy so far with the charger and glad people gave good reviews so I’ll add mine to it. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: MOTOPOWER Battery Charger/Maintainer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this charger on the 8th of December 2018 but did not use it but for the last month or so and at first gave it a 5-Star Rating because it worked great until today it stopped working this thing is junk I guess you get what you pay for I lost $15.00 in the thing because Amazon said I had had it too long to return it it should have lasted more than a month but it didn't don't waste your money on this unit. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Anthony Shaw, Who knows!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second purchase of motopower but a different model. First I used on a fully charged battery. When I hooked it up it went straight to charge maintainer immediately. After several hours status light remained the same. Second attempt was to use a 50% battery - light turned on for "charging". After about 8 hours no change in status. Next I disconnected negative from battery with "green" light stayed on. Next disconnected the positive, the charger continued to read charging. I then had both leads disconnected and yet the charger continued to read charging (green light). Regardless of what strength battery used or connection the result was the same.
customer_reviews.author: Avis A. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU WANT "ZEREO PRODUCT" SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it, hooked it up, gt so HOT.... I had to unplug it for SAFTEY CONCERNS. Tried to contact Seller 3x. ! on Amazon, and 2x via there website..... NOTHING! It can be the VIRUS, they had no problem taking the MONEY ! NEVER AGAIN! The battery is 8 months Old never a issue, back to using a Regular Charger! Will BUY one from Pulse Power........... the have Excellent Equipment and LIVE SUPPORT, which actually does something more than talk a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: you are going to love this. it tells you in the instructions that it will not charge a dead battery. in 45 years i have wasted alot of money on weird crap. this is hands down the BIGGEST waste of money by far. dont even contemplate spending money on this giant piece of @#%&.
customer_reviews.author: Fatman

customer_reviews.title: Working good so far
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 1/2 a year and it’s keeping my riding mower battery ready to use and fully charged. The indicator lights tell me what’s going on so a quick peek and I know all is well. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: 1000mAh is VERY slow
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this to trickle charge a severely dead car battery out of the car. I knew that 1000mAh would result in a slow charge, but it took 5 days for the charge light to turn green indicating full charge. If you are buying this to trickle charge a good battery so that it is fresh and ready to use, this will probably work great since it is so gentle. However, for my intended use of trying to charge a battery in a day or two wasn't successful. I returned this and got a 4000mAh charger to avoid the long wait.
customer_reviews.author: bongo

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve
customer_reviews.text: This unit was easy to use and seems to be a great value for the money. I bought it for use on a CSB HR1234WF2 - 12 Volt/9 Amp Hour (34 Watts) Sealed Lead Acid Battery with 0.250 in. Fast-on Terminals that I was using with a Humminbird Ice Kit. At first I was disappointed that it did not charge as fast as the charger that came with my MarCum but soon realized my batteries were not being over charge according to there charging specifications.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lives

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in and it just works
customer_reviews.text: Hooked the lead to the battery on my motorcycle. Then I just plug it in and forget it. It charges when needed, maintains when needed. You don't have to do anything. I would have prefered a shorter cord and longer leads. Then I could screw it to the wall by the outlet and still plug it into the bike. But it does the job I need. With this product I never have to worry that the bike sat too long without starting and is dead. I know when I'm ready to ride, so is my bike.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Never had such a smart charger
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST charger I have owned, I use it on my pontoon fishing boat mounted in the boat and with a newly installed outlet on my dock no more going out to a dead deep cell battery. Charges fully in about 3 hours, 100Ah deep cell AGM. I would HIGHLY recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have three jet skis and I live in NY, so most these things spend long, cold winters in a garage. I have each one on one of these chargers and they all start right up in the spring. The batteries are now lasting longer as well. I used to have to replace them every two years. I bought my first one of these 3 years ago. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: pdc54321

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Comes with a permanent connector for the battery.
customer_reviews.text: This charger/Maintainer is super easy to use, just install the included permanent battery connector and plug it in. I installed it on a snowmobile, but you can put it on any 12 volt battery. As a bonus it also desulphates the battery. I have read that this may or may not work, and if it does it will be over time. If the battery lasts many years, I would say it works. I'll let you know in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: S. Krytus

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.  Good little chargers.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for the race car trailer. I have them wired in to charge different lead acid deep cycle batteries when I plug into shore power or the generator. Batteries last longer when kept fully charged, and this little charger keeps them at 100% charge. They are fully automatic so i never have to touch them. I just check the LED lights once in a while to be sure they are still working.
customer_reviews.author: Leader

customer_reviews.title: Did not work. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up, and it said "power", but it was not charging. I tried with the clips and the plug in thing. My mom's charger worked fine. They try to make this stuff "advanced" and build in voltmeters to detect the battery, but it's all garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Zane Hitchcox

customer_reviews.title: Battery cutoff didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to work fine. I installed it and checked a few days later and it had shut off the battery just like it should. Checked it again a few days later and again it did just what it was supposed to. However when I tried to start their a couple months later the battery was almost dead-it did not shut off the power from the battery. Really a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Harold H Suain

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for 16 months
customer_reviews.text: This was used to keep my JD tractor battery charged. Worked great for about 16 months. Quit for no reason so I took the cover off to see if it was something obvious. There is an internal fuse, but that was fine and the 120VAC power was measured on the circuit board input, so it wasn't an issue with the power cable or plug. 0 VDC output and LED is not illuminated. No way to easily troubleshoot to the component level so I cut the output cord and chucked the rest in the trash. I probably should have checked Amazon first as I see that the unit comes with a two-year warranty. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: KJ Speed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Nice tidy small package, great for charging fishfinder and other small batteries. Only used it one time so far, but it works great and is made with high quality materials. Well Done!
customer_reviews.author: James Flinchbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as intended.
customer_reviews.text: This maintainer did not properly maintain the battery. The whole point was using a device to keep the battery nearly charged and extend it's life. This device apparently does not have overcharge protection of any kind. On my application, it severely overcharged the battery and boiled all the acid out. It did the opposite of it's intended propose. Don't use this device to maintain your battery because it just destroys it.
customer_reviews.author: botto

customer_reviews.title: Worth it by far
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, restored my dead dead mytorcycle batter that was 18 months old(used 8 months worth of and on) that had sat for 9 months. Battery was reading less than 8.03v and is now at 12.38v after one nights worth of charging and a full days rest. Ill be installing the bolt on plug and conecting this if I dont plan on riding for a week for now on. The battery is way too much work to get to to replace.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I have used the MOTOPOWER MP00205A 12V 800mA Fully Automatic Battery Charger/Maintainer for nearly two years on a 2010 Prius that sits in a garage for 2-4 months at a time in between uses. The charger/maintainer has worked flawlessly on the 12V gel battery. Installation that allows for a quick disconnect (for recurring vehicle use) was perfect for my application. The price was excellent and delivery was swift. Overall - I recommend this charger/maintainer.
customer_reviews.author: David Camille

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't get hot and it is automatic.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my campervan's 12v deep cycle battery and so far it's keeping the battery fully charged to 13.5v then it slowly decrease the voltage to 12.7v I am happy with it because I can remotely turn it on via the internet by using a Wi-Fi enable plug when I am not home. I left it on overnight and this charger doesn't get very hot. The only thing I dislike it is that it looks like a used one. The label has lots of scratches.
customer_reviews.author: CarNut

customer_reviews.title: Good Charger
customer_reviews.text: Used this to charge my two boat batteries for winter storage. Worked fine. I also had a truck that was sitting and the battery was DEAD! The charger would not charge it. It was too dead. So I took my old 2/10/start charger and put it on a ten amp charge to try to kick start it for a few hours. Then I put it on the MotoPower charger and it worked. It took a full day or so but now the battery is charged. Haven't reinstalled it yet but it charged and stayed charged.
customer_reviews.author: rcondude

customer_reviews.title: It has to be a good battery.
customer_reviews.text: Work even as a charger as long as your battery is not dead. It doesn't have to have three prongs to work. 5 Stars for product. O stars for customer service as I was it wasn't working, tried to get answers and the guy was rude and only 30 seconds or less on the phone. I figured it out myself. It has to be a good battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires the battery to be 66% charged in order to work
customer_reviews.text: The charge light never turned on. Tried the disconnect/unplug/reconnect thing the instructions suggested and the light still did not turn on. Further review of the instructions I found the battery has to have at least an 8V charge in order for this 'charger' to work and, if it doesn't, I should use a bulk charger before using this one. This is a battery charger that needs another battery charger to start charging a battery.
customer_reviews.author: S. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to use during winter storage of my boat. It only lasted 2 winter seasons that is around 8 months. I was very disappointed with I went to get the boat out of storage and my battery was dead. This product cost me $120.00 for a new battery. I will purchase another product.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Behrent

customer_reviews.title: stay away!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a UTV battery that was working perfectly fine. It was a few years old so I figured I should keep it topped off. What a big mistake. Now the battery no longer accepts a charge from my regular charger. I had to buy an new battery. Returned this unit in just under the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Justchillin

customer_reviews.title: It works OK.
customer_reviews.text: This is adequate, but not stellar. Gets a little warm even with a fully charged motorcycle battery. Wires are thin and short compared to a Battery Tender I have. That one cost more than 2X as much however. So, you get what you pay for. If it lasts I will be happy. So a good cheap solution.
customer_reviews.author: Salli & GeneTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Use Battery maintainer for my boat, stored sports car, tractor and my truck. The battery in my tractor is 11 years old and not used a lot, it stars first crank every time as do all of my other vehicles that have a battery. It also desulfinates your lead acid battery for longer life.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love it.  Half the price of a charger from a big box store and it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to recharge the deep cycle batteries that power my electric fence. Its straightforward, easy to use, well built and recharged 7Ah batteries quickly. It has rescued and restored batteries that I allowed to discharge way too low several times ( discharged to <5V rather than only 11.5V) I will absolutely buy it again if I have the need to.
customer_reviews.author: toenail

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I use these battery maintainer on all of my ATVs, tractor, lawn mower, and even on my F250 Super Duty that has a slow electrical leak. It comes with the option to permanently attach to the battery or clip on to it. If possible i always permanently attach it to the battery and leave the wire hanging just out from the seat or somewhere out of the way but easy to hook back up when i return. Since i have started using battery maintainers my batteries last much longer than they use to.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Singletary

customer_reviews.title: Died within 2 years. Trash
customer_reviews.text: I got maybe 1 year out of it. Light went out on charger and battery subsequently died. It’s such a pain to install a battery on a motorcycle, at least mine, let alone install the charger rings, what a hassle to change it out. I contacted the manufacturer and heard nothing.
customer_reviews.author: KCJP

customer_reviews.title: Not even a full season
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first couple of months. Came back and checked. No lights. Check connections. All good. Cracked the case of the unit. Roasted. Under-power resistor cooked. Popped the internal (non-replaceable) fuse. Junk! Into the trash it goes! Will not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: PrincessPeach

customer_reviews.title: Great except for wire length
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this none five stars ***** but the leads for attaching to the battery were just a little shorter than other models I am using. I have a hard time keeping the charging plug outside of my ATV's plastics. 2" or more on the cord that attaches to the battery would have been great even if the cord attached to the charger was a little shorter.
customer_reviews.author: stst

customer_reviews.title: Not doing 2 amps and always says full
customer_reviews.text: LED indicators not what they should be. I'm hooked up to a 10 amp/hr LiFe battery. Measuring the charge rate after my battery is over half way discharged and this unit is only doing 1.3 amps (supposed to be 2 amps) and it is lighting up the full charge indicator light already. Check 5 hours later it still says full charge and yet it's still running .8 amp into the battery. So if it's full why are you still charging for 6+ hours? Eventually the charge rate will drop to 0, then the battery is truly full. What will the LED still be showing... full.
customer_reviews.author: T. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Maintaining 13.7 Volts on an AGM Battery - Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this inexpensive tender and I'm really happy I did. This is replacing a Battery Tender Jr. that would only keep the AGM battery in my Goldwing at 12.2 volts. This little gem is keeping my battery at 13.7 volts. Goldwings are voltage hogs on startup so it appears that this unit will be my battery's best friend!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped functioning after first use
customer_reviews.text: Owned this unit for just over a year an used it 3 times on power wheels and riding lawn motor batteries. Worked the first time. But every other time Light always stays green no matter what battery it’s connected to. Per my multimeter no voltage is being measured out if the unit. It’s been too long for a refund even though it looks and is basically brand new.... and what a waste of money... Go with the energizer model
customer_reviews.author: Bdp01

customer_reviews.title: It works better than I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: It uses a single led this tells you what the charger is doing. Problem is the print is so small I cant read it. Even with my readers on. Other wise thatsit on the negative side. I used it to revive two batteries which were almost zero voltage to 14.! With no power storage problems. I ordered 3 more!
customer_reviews.author: Steven M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy a serious charger
customer_reviews.text: This unit really lacks the output power to charge much of anything. Sending it back. Clamps provided are of really flimsy sheet metal and bent easily. The red and black plastic insulating caps on the clamps broke off right away from just opening the jaw of the clamp. My battery was at 8 volts, unit wouldn't even go into charge mode. Took it and the batter to our battery dealer, who said the charger is useless at .8 volts. And no, he doesn't sell chargers, just batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Weimer

customer_reviews.title: very good price and it comes with a quick connect end ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just as i expected, very good price and it comes with a quick connect end and quick connect adapter to make it easy to connect up something ( in my case a portable generator battery ) One thing to be aware of, this is rated for less than an amp output truly a trickle charger for any large batteries and if anything is connected that draws power it might negate the charging power this can provide.
customer_reviews.author: Heath J. Meetis

customer_reviews.title: Will only work with fully charged battery. Manual assumes you are plugging into a GFI outlet
customer_reviews.text: The description reads " Fully Automatic Battery Charger Maintainer" What was not mentioned in the description that it would not change a battery that is not fully charged it reads < 8 volts in the manual. So you will need to charge the battery with a battery charger first which is why i bought this device. Another omission is the manual insists to use a GFI outlet with the device. It seems there is a creep of bad descriptions on Amazon these days. I switched to Amazon a couple of years ago because of my past concern with this at eBay. But i never had to return something from eBay.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Will cause damage to your battery
customer_reviews.text: Apparently this thing won't charge a dead battery, and accordingly it will damage batteries that are left on it; which is counter to everything written about it. Just about everything Amazon sells is made in China and is this. China is known for poor products.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice silent battery charger/maintainer. The indicator lights show you a status of the charging process/battery status. I love it and I'm sure you would too. I have it for just few days now and cant say how long it may last, but so far have trickle charged three of my vehicles' batteries.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Works on low batteries
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Helped in bringing a couple of old batteries back to usable states. Makes a heck of a charger, but being so small it does get warm. Have been able to pick it up right after removing from battery so it's not too hot. D
customer_reviews.author: Darrel Durbin

customer_reviews.title: Good charger for smaller batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to charge my generator starter sealed maintenance free battery. It charged reasonably fast and I could use it to float charge it long term. I would say if you are trying to charge car batteries, I would get the higher amperage chargers they sell. This is good for small batteries, or larger ones but they will take more time to charge. If you need to just float charge a car that is stored for a while, this should do the job as well. It's smaller than I expected, but well made.
customer_reviews.author: AutoxSTI

customer_reviews.title: It does not work; instead, it killed the battery.
customer_reviews.text: My vehicle is CRV 2018, so the battery is less than two years. Before I used the Battery Charger/Maintainer, the battery had been able to get recharged. After I tried the Battery Charger/Maintainer for five days (I needed to be away), the battery cannot be recharged any more. It is totally dead.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t maintain battery
customer_reviews.text: Kept it plugged to my bike for a month, and bike wouldn’t start. Plugged it back in, and says ‘charging’ through the led. Come back 30 mins later and the led is showing ‘discharging’. Bike still wouldn't start. Had to use a ‘real’ battery charger.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: They don't seem to last
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 or 5 of these...they work OK for a while, and then don't. Only 1 of mine still work after 6-7 months. Took them apart and there are burned components on the circuit board.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice slow charger
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice automatic slow charger for car battiers, only reason i am giving it 4 stars is because if your battery is very dead it will not turn on and beginning charging it. So you need to force a bit of a charge in it from alt, or another battery charger then this one will work if your battery is not completely dead it will charge and mant. it no problems. Slow charging a almost dead/dead battery is best to insure a proper chargering and full cycle
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Smith

customer_reviews.title: keep your car's batter alive while traveling
customer_reviews.text: We have an Lexus SUV that isn't driven very much, and it draws power when parked like so many modern vehicles do. That means if we are gone for weeks it very likely won't start when we return. Plug this in before we go and its always ready when we return. Plus you won't have to replace the car's battery every few years like we had to before.
customer_reviews.author: pilotSteve

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE:  Charger failed after only 5 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: I've contacted MotoPower customer service twice and not received a response or a replacement. I would not recommend buying this charger or dealing with this company. The product is cheaply made overseas (China) and customer service is nonresponsive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dyer

customer_reviews.title: EXTREME FIRE HAZARD
customer_reviews.text: This charger caught on fire as soon as I put it on the battery luckily I had an extinguisher nearby or else would have burned house down! Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Edward S

customer_reviews.title: Undecided.
customer_reviews.text: Found out my battery was completely dead so wasn't able to test it but used similar trickle chargers in the past without issue. Not super excited with construction of the clamps themselves, very weak and likely the first point of failure in the future.
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is nice......
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I purchased this to charge a small 35ah trolling motor battery. Works great and has a few different plugs to fit your needs. My truck battery died and would not turn over. I could not find my jumper cables and was in a bind. I did not think this had anywhere near enough power to crank my V8 crew cab Tundra but I had no other options so I plugged it up. Let it sit for 20 min and it fired right up... Would defiantly buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Doug E.

customer_reviews.title: MAY WANNA LOOK AT SOMETHING ELSE...Was awesome...no longer works...
customer_reviews.text: CURRENT - After it took a poop 6-9 months ago decided to say this thing doesn't work now. Plus into the wall, ONLY shows GREEN - CHARGED (regardless whether it's plugged into my bike or not...MAY wanna spend a bit more $ and get something better unless a battery tender working for 1 season is okay with you. OLD REVIEW - Works awesome, highly recommend. It even comes with quick clicks like you were jumping a car so you're not doing a permanent terminal install.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Cierniewski

customer_reviews.title: died first time it was used.
customer_reviews.text: bought for a motorcycle. Seemed to run correctly when first plugged in. But next morning, put on a second battery, known to be dead, solid green LED indicated full charge. Full charge indicator stayed on no matter if leads connected, on dead battery or whatever. Unplugged for a while to see if micro-processor was thinking, but no change. Used a VOM to confirm it had no output. Nice design and package, if it worked....
customer_reviews.author: Dave Whitcomb

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge if your battery is completely dead.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2019 Street Glide Special that had all power drained and when the ignition is flipped, the bike has no power. Tried to plug in the charger and it wouldn't charge. After looking at the manual, it stated that it wouldn't charge if the batter has less than 8V. So basically I purchased a paperweight. It would've been nice to know when I was searching for a battery charger. Now I have to purchase another one that will charge dead batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Traiye Smith

customer_reviews.title: not impressed
customer_reviews.text: worked fine for long enough to get beyond return date, then it just quit, no lights, no output, no reason, I'll try customer support, sometimes this cheap chinese crap has fairly good customer support, mostly not! I'll update with results
customer_reviews.author: 3cells

customer_reviews.title: It works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Its a maintainer for the battery. It seems to work, but I could not check its capability to de-sulfate because my scope was broken and I ended up throwing away the old battery, bought a new one and also a new larger de-sulfa-tor.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Wechsler

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge a depleted 12-volt battery. Will think it's a fully charged 6 volt
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 12 volt battery that is dead and around 6 volts this charger thinks that it's a 6 volt battery and fully charged. I had to hook up a second fully charged 12 volt battery to my dead battery and this charger to trick it into charging. So a pretty worthless charger don't buy these automatic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: FAIL!!  DIRECTION STATE (YOU DON'T GET THIS UNTIL YOU BUY IT) THIS WILL NOT CHARGE A DEAD BATTERY!!!
customer_reviews.text: FAIL!! DIRECTION STATE (YOU DON'T GET THIS UNTIL YOU BUY IT) THIS WILL NOT CHARGE A DEAD BATTERY!!! Check out the description - everything talks about this amazing microprocessor controlled automatic battery charger that we'll do everything including making the coffee but NOWHERE does it state that it will NOT charge a dead battery - THE MOST BASIC FEATURE OF A BATTERY CHARGER. 100% FAIL. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but works very well
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting a lot for $20, but the charger works very well. I have a bike that sits quite a bit and the battery is often low when I do ride it. Attached this charger to the quick connect charge cable on the bike and didn't have any more problems.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for maintaining and very light charging
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my lawnmower battery charged up, but have since used it to maintain several batteries I have around. It’s not the kind of charger you use on a dead battery, but for just maintaining a charge, it works well. The small size makes it ideal for moving around from one battery to another.
customer_reviews.author: Chad P.

customer_reviews.title: Best I have found to date! Just buy it already...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Will do a follow up review in couple months, only reason for the 4 stars otherwise would easily be 5 stars. Got it for my atv when my "battery tender" one died on me. So far I like this one a lot more! Will probably be getting the bigger one for my trucks...
customer_reviews.author: Cletus

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cheap. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Didnt work straight out of the box. The plastic is hard cheap kind that seems like it will crack easily if dropped. The quick connectors are not made to the right tolerances so its very hard to connect them and they dont fully push together. Saw a reivew on youtube after i placed the order and it whistled like a mf while charging. Returned same day recieved. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard!!!!!!!  Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: PCB board burned on me. Do not buy, don't risk burning your house down. I smelled something odd in the garage one day and went to check my charger. LED light was off, and it wasn't charging. I opened it up and found the PCB board melted the circuits. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: sam765

product_meta.title: MOTOPOWER MP00205A 12V 800mA Fully Automatic Battery Charger/Maintainer - Rescue and Recover Batteries
feature_bullets: 🔥[ Compact, Smart & Durable ] - It can charge all types of 12V lead-acid batteries, including flooded or sealed maintenance free batteries (AGM & gel cell). It's the best smart charger for automotive, motorcycle, marine, RV, Powersport, lawn&garden, children toys, etc.

🔥[ Fully Automatic ] - No need of any manual operation, just plug and leave it for charging and maintaining your batteries automatically for long time. The microprocessor controlled program will monitor the whole charging progress and automatically stop when the battery is fully charged. Then it will monitor the battery voltage and maintain the battery with a float charging current. Zero output ( 0 Volt on DC port ) in standby mode without connecting with the battery to save energy.

🔥[ Multi-level Safety Protection & Battery Rescue ] - Micro-processor Controlled program. No worry about overcharge, short circuit and reverse polarity. Spark-free technology applied. Featured Constant Pulse Current Maintenance function helps the battery avoid excessive charge and discharge. It will extend the battery life and recover batteries more effectively.

🔥[ SAE Quick Release Adapters ] - With SAE quick release connection options: Ring Terminals (7.5amp fused for safety protection) or Alligator Clips. With the ring terminal harness connecting with the battery permanently, it's so easy to connect the charger by the SAE adapters when needed. Fuse protection will avoid danger of short circuit or overload.

🔥[ Two-year Warranty & ETL Safety Certified ] - Energy Saving design with one LED indicator to display different charging status. Certified by CE, RoHS, UL and CEC. Conform to the CEC (​CALIFORNIA ENERGY COMMISSION) standard - BC mark. TWO YEAR WARRANTY AND 100% SATISFACTION SERVICE - Hassle-free return or refund for any product quality issue. 100% satisfaction service and technical assistance will be provided by contacting our professional customer service team.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,489 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars

categories: Jump Starters, Battery Chargers & Portable Power
